alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Livingston; St. John The Baptist; St. Tammany; Tangipahoa (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 30 at 10:16AM CST until December 30 at 1:15PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Livingston Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern St. John The Baptist Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Western St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southern Tangipahoa Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 115 PM CST. * At 1016 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Scattered reports of roads flooded around Livingston and French Settlement HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Hammond, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Ponchatoula, Walker, Livingston, Independence, French Settlement, Albany, Port Vincent, Springfield, Whitehall, Natalbany, Watson, Shenandoah, Greenwell Spring and Old Jefferson. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 155 and 168. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 15 and 41. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 52. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Livingston; St. John The Baptist; St. Tammany; Tangipahoa
